question: We æton and (drincan) #### beforan ðe — We ate and drank before you
explanation: Here 'drincan' is in the plural past form 'druncon' because the subject is 'We'

question: Ðu monegum (helpan) #### — You help many
explanation: Here 'helpan' is in the second person singular present form 'helpst' because the subject is 'Ða munecas'

question: Stuf ond Wihtgar (feohtan) #### wið Bryttas — Stuf and Wihtgar fought against the Britons
explanation: Here 'feohtan' is in the plural past form 'fuhton' because the subject is 'Stuf ond Wihtgar'

question: Ic astigie min scyp ond (weorpan) #### max mine on ea — I get into a boat, and throw my nets in the river
explanation: Here 'weorpan' is in the first person singular present form 'weorpe' because the subject is 'Ic'

question: He ðe mid wite (gieldan) #### — He repays you with punishment
explanation: Here 'gieldan' is in the third person singular present form 'gielt' because the subject is 'he'

commonMistakes.explanation: Don't forget, whenever conjugation produces 'tþ' after another consonant, it is changed to 't' so 'gieldan' becomes 'gielt'
Don't forget, whenever conjugation produces 'tþ' after another consonant, it is changed to 't' so 'gieldan' becomes 'gielt'

question: Fæste ic (bindan) #### þa wealas — I bind the foreigners fast
explanation: Here 'bindan' is in the first person singular present form 'binde' because the subject is 'ic'

question: Seo burh (sincan) #### on eorþan — The town sank into the earth
explanation: Here 'sincan' is in the third person singular past form 'sanc' because the subject is 'Seo burh'

question: Se fugol (singan) #### swa ond swinsað sælum geblissad, oððaet seo sunne on suð—rodor sæged weorðeð — The bird so sings and whistles, bouyed up with bliss, until the sun has sunk into the southern sky
explanation: Here 'singan' is in the third person singular present form 'singð' because the subject is 'Se fugol'

question: Ic fleah mid fuglum ond on flode (swimman) #### — I flew among birds and swam in the sea
explanation: Here 'swimman' is in the first person singular past form 'swom' because the subject is 'ic'

question: Ge (belgan) #### wið me forðam þe ic gehælde anne man on restedæge — You are angry with me because I cured a man on a Sabbath
explanation: Here 'belgan' is in the plural form 'belgaþ' because the subject is 'Ge'

question: Hie (delfan) #### ane mycle dic — They dug a great ditch
explanation: Here 'delfan' is in the plural past form 'dulfon' because the subject is 'Ge'

question: Swa weax (meltan) ####, gif hit byð wearmum — So wax melts if it is warm
explanation: Here 'meltan' is in the third person singular present form 'milt' because the subject is 'weax'

commonMistakes.explanation: Don't forget, whenever conjugation produces 'tþ' after another consonant, it is changed to 't' so 'meltan' becomes 'milt'
Don't forget, whenever conjugation produces 'tþ' after another consonant, it is changed to 't' so 'meltan' becomes 'milt'

question: On forewerdne morgen ic drife sceap mine to hira læse ond (melcan) #### hie tweowa on dæg — In the morning I drive the sheep to their pasture and milk them twice a day
explanation: Here 'melcan' is in the first person singular present form 'melce' because the subject is 'ic'

question: Se draca hie (swelgan) #### and he eft aspaw — The dragon sallowed her and afterwards vomited
explanation: Here 'swelgan' is in the third person singular past form 'swealg' because the subject is 'Se draca'

question: Seo wunde (swellan) #### æfter þrim dagum — The wound swelled after three days
explanation: Here 'swellan' is in the third person singular past form 'sweall' because the subject is 'Se wunde'

question: Se cyning ne (drincan) #### win ne beor — the king drank neither wine nor beer
explanation: Here 'drincan' is in the third person singular past form 'dranc' because the subject is 'Se cyning'

question: Ðu (drincan) #### seftne drenc ond swetne — You drank a mild and sweet drink
explanation: Here 'drincan' is in the second person singular past form 'drunce' because the subject is 'Ðu'

question: Ðonne ðu (helpan) #### me — When you helped me
explanation: Here 'helpan' is in the second person singular past form 'hulpe' because the subject is 'ðu'

question: Guðlac wið deoflum (feohtan) #### — Guthlac fought with devils
explanation: Here 'feohtan' is in the third person singular past form 'feaht' because the subject is 'Guðlac'
